creator: husted@apache.org
text:
This works fine:

      <!-- Define the default virtual host -->
      <Host name="localhost" debug="0" unpackWARs="true"
		appBase="d:/public/tomcat4/webapps" >

This is processed as a relative path.

      <!-- Define the default virtual host -->
      <Host name="localhost" debug="0" unpackWARs="true"
		appBase="/public/tomcat4/webapps" >

-Ted.
*** Bug 3724 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
creator: remm@apache.org
craig.mcclanahan@sun.com
text:
Note that the java.io.File class indeed considers "/public/tomcat4/webapps" to
be a non-absolute path, because it is relative to the current drive letter.  I
don't believe it would be a good idea to make Tomcat vary from the JDK's
interpretation of this.

creator: craig.mcclanahan@sun.com
text:
It's not appropriate for Tomcat to second guess what the JDK determines is a
relative path.
